intro: Teucrium franchetianum, commonly known as French teucrium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to violet, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Teucrium franchetianum is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
